intro: Dianthus scaber subsp. cutandae, commonly known as the rough carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its flowers are often used in floral arrangements due to their vibrant color and long-lasting nature. The subspecies is closely related to other Dianthus species, sharing similar botanical features such as the presence of glandular hairs and a distinctive scent.
